context: After incubation of the homogenates with lactose or lactose ureide, galactose-dehydrogenase (in citrate–potassium buffer) was added followed by a further incubation (12 min at room temperature). The extinctions were measured at 365 nm and the amount of galactose was calculated. The protein concentration in all samples was determined by the method of Lowryusing bovine serum albumin as standards. Lactose ureide and maltose ureide were synthesized by acid-catalyzed condensation of lactose/maltose and urea according to the method of Hoffmann [11, 12]. Arabinose ureide was synthesized using the method developed by Helfrich and Kosche. Cellobiose ureide was produced by dissolving 15 g of d-cellobiose and 5.26 g urea in 22 ml boiling water. The mixture was cooled to room temperature and then adjusted to pH 3.
